text: hello everyone Eddie Smith here from
Midwestern marks had this idea for a
video um for the Bernie campaign when we
were working for Bernie they would have
us um prepare a personal story of why we
worked for Bernie right why we came to
the radical left so that when we were
talking to people while door knocking we
could explain our story um a little bit
corny but I thought it would actually
make a good idea for a video CU a lot of
people ask me you know you don't look
like a leftist you look like a trump
supporter what brought you to the left
you know a lot of athletes or whatever
aren't on the left so what happened um
so I want to explain my story because
everyone has their own story of what of
what brought them to leftist politics or
radical politics so what happened was in
2011 um I lived in Wisconsin and my dad
was a teacher and the governor Scott
Walker Republican Governor um who I now
know has um deep deep ties to the
Republican establishment tons of coch
Brothers money and money from other us
oligarchs but anyways um Walker passed
Act 10 I think it was called or um yes
Act 10 and what it did was it destroyed
teachers collective bargaining rights so
unionization you know so um teachers
ability to to strike or to fight for for
better wages um organized labor right
what what um the capitalists kind of
always do is um destroy use the
government to destroy organized Labor uh
stop teachers from collective bargaining
and made a huge cut to the teachers
paycheck which the teachers agreed to
you know they said cut our paycheck but
don't take our unions um but that's
never what it was about you know they
they wanted to to do both of those
things so they did and and what wer said
was this is to stop the debt right we
have all this debt that's piling up and
being naive at the time my family kind
of fell for it like oh there must be all
this debt you know what are we going to
do we got to take care of the debt and
then a handful of years later Walker
turned around and gave $4.1 billion in
subsidies to foxcon multi National
company and Wisconsin's debt is
currently something like 2020 billion so
we're like so you had to cut the salary
of the teachers the people who take care
of the kids but you could find $4.1
billion dollar for the
corporation and right there it was
pretty apparent to me um even in middle
school and high school at the time I'm
like all right this system is definitely
wrong like there's something to be upset
about here there's this is not right um
and at that same time Bernie was running
right and of course I was scared of the
word socialist um but but my friend um
who happened to be a girl who I had a
crush on started telling me about Bernie
which softened my stance to socialism
you know anytime she was talking I was
like interesting so I actually listen um
and I heard Le Bernie was talking about
I'm like this is common sense right like
you know um this is not this doesn't
seem radical you know the current system
seems broken what this guy's proposing
seems to be common sense so whatever got
into politics you know I was still at
the time kind of flirting with like Ben
Shapiro and like anti-feminist you know
anti- um BLM weird stuff I grew up in
like a really conservative town you know
conservative high school so there was a
lot of those influences on me went to
college um in college I had no idea what
I wanted to major in they asked uh what
you're interested in um on like one of
the intro surveys and I said politics um
they threw me in some politics classes
and then I was like this is amazing I
love studying politics um actually it
took about a year or two before I really
got into it um but yeah uh while I was
in college another thing happened a
hurricane hit Puerto Rico um and Puerto
Rico was a place where I had done um
some work in high school we built a
house um for a woman in Puerto Rico who
didn't have one she was living in
poverty we went over there with the
church you know people are critical of
missions trips um including myself but
this was actually really cool we went
over there and we built a house for a
lady who didn't have a home
um and then when Puerto Rico got hit by
a hurricane of course Trump didn't do
anything about it he went down there um
denied how many people had been killed
by the hurricane and there was that
famous video of him throwing out um
paper towels and I was like this is
disgusting and then not only that um but
Desh duza uh one of Trump's sycophant
tweeted out uh colonies usually give the
countries that own them resources and
labor blah blah blah what does Puerto
Rico do for the US basically saying we
shouldn't help them with with a
hurricane cuz they don't give us enough
despite the fact that Puerto Ricans
serve in the US military um us
corporations make tons of money in
Puerto Rico you know Puerto Rican labor
goes to keeping the country going like
any territory territory it's really a
colony um so that was just disgusting
and at the same time that that happened
I was really um learning about
imperialism um I had a professor who uh
was a Marxist got his PhD in China um
had studied in China a lot and and he
wasn't biased in any way he just made
really comprehensive Arguments for why
things happen in the world um and
they're arguments kind of based in
Marxism so he didn't push Marxism on me
um someone I knew through the Bernie
campaign um got me to start reading Marx
which really started to inform my
worldview another book I read was the
divide by Jason hickle which is
basically how the US underdeveloped the
global South right how um why the global
South is poor um and how the the
neocolonialism and imperialism happens
in the modern era how the US has
purposefully kept the US in Western
Capital has purposefully kept the global
South poor um and and that's basically
brought me to where I was today another
um a big phase that I went through in
college was a Social Democrat phase I
was watching Kyle kolinsky who basically
just lays out you know we need health
care raise the minimum wage and the wars
um not really based in theory uh which I
agree with all those in sentiment but
then and you know a really good quote
that um a buddy of mine I don't know
where it originates from but it's his
Tik Tock bio the communard is his Tik
Tok it says to be radical is to grasp
things by the root and and that's what
Marxism does right it looks at the mode
of production um how humans spend their
time and how humans organize um
production within Society um and then
how the contradictions within our mode
of production lead to all these ills and
these things that we don't like within
our society so that's how I came to the
left and that's how I came to Marxism
gave you the personal side um and then
also how I started to develop
intellectually uh it doesn't really
matter as long as you know your heart's
in the right place and you're doing your
best um to keep fighting for the right
stuff yeah that's all I got to say so I
hope you guys enjoyed this video um
peace out
